qas.question: Who was appointed acting President of Yale in 1977?
Where did Hanna Holborn Gray go after Yale?
In what year did Judith Rodin become the first female president of an Ivy League school?
In what year did Susan Hockfield become President of MIT?
Who became Vice Chancellor of the University of Cambridge in 2002?
Who was appointed acting President of Yale in 1979?
Where did Hanna Holborn Gray go before Yale?
In what year did Judith Rodin become the first male president of an Ivy League school?
In what year did Susan Hockfield become President of IMT?
Who became Chancellor of the University of Cambridge in 2002?

context: The Yale Provost's Office has launched several women into prominent university presidencies. In 1977 <a0_0><b5_0>Hanna Holborn Gray<b5_0/><a0_0/> was appointed acting President of Yale from this position, and went on to become President of the <a1_0><b6_0>University of Chicago<b6_0/><a1_0/>, the first woman to be full president of a major university. In <a2_0><b7_0>1994<b7_0/><a2_0/> Yale Provost Judith Rodin became the first female president of an Ivy League institution at the University of Pennsylvania. In 2002 Provost <a4_0><b9_0>Alison Richard<b9_0/><a4_0/> became the Vice Chancellor of the University of Cambridge. In <a3_0><b8_0>2004<b8_0/><a3_0/>, Provost Susan Hockfield became the President of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. In 2007 Deputy Provost Kim Bottomly was named President of Wellesley College. In 2003, the Dean of the Divinity School, Rebecca Chopp, was appointed president of Colgate University and now heads Swarthmore College.
